dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colored light from the billboard flickers over a bullet riddled sign: ROUTE 85. U.S. BORDER, EL PASO, TEXAS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beneath the sign is a LONG BLACK LIMOUSINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars whip past on the highway. Then A VAN passes, blastin some future version of Techno Latino Hip Hop. A SQUEAL OF TIRES OS. Now the music gets louder as the van returns, cruising slowly past the black limo before pulling into t lot. Five Bangers bail out and check out the black stretc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo doors are locked, windows tinted, so they can't what's inside, but they check out the tires and wheels an like what they see. With the speed of a pit crew, they op the back of the van and out come TOOLS AND A JACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move over the back bench, past empty bottles, fast foo wrappers as A SLEEPING MAN'S FACE ratchets into frame. He opens his red eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man is LOGAN aka The Wolverine or more accurately, Dr Wolverine. He blinks, dazed, feeling the car lurching upw Older than we've seen him, he clutches a Tequila bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the back door opens, the tequila bottle drops to the d and A BOOTED LEG STEPS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan shuffles, stiff, to the other side of the stretch w the Bangers work, removing wheels, lit by colored light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Uh. Please stop, guys. Those,.. those are chrome plated lugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all five turn. Some pull guns on the drunk limo driv He just keeps talking, slurring some...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: you're gonna strip `em. Plating flakes off, you know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Jittery Banger cocks his shotgun. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a lease, you know, and no one wants to pay to ride in a--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- THE JITTERY BANGER FIRES. Blows Logan right off his fe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now might be a good time to talk about "fights" described the next 100 or so pages. Basically, if you're on the mak for a hyper choreographed, gravity defying, city-block destroying, CG fuckathon, this ain't your movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In this flick, people will get hurt or killed when shit f on them. They will get just as hurt or just as killed if get hit with something big and heavy like, say, a car. Sh anyone in our story have the misfortune to fall off a roo out a window, they won't bounce. They will die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As for our hero with his so-called eternal life and heali Well, he's older now. If you keep reading, you'll discove Logan's about to get his ass kicked. But before we get to that, we should make it clear his abilities ain't what th were. Yes, he's a drunk, but he's also fading on the insi Adamantium implants leeching into his system, causing chr pain and diminished healing, hence booze as painkiller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So by all means, go ahead and worry about him. Now where were we? Oh, yeah--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the smoke settles, a CROWBAR-toting Banger angrily che out Jitters in Spanish for firing. The others resume thei work... none aware of Logan slowly getting up, till --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys... seriously... (gets to his feet) You don't wanna do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bangers react to Logan with bafflement. Ad-lib Spanis reactions, nervous chuckles --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CROWBAR presses down JITTER'S gun as he moves to Logan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a familiar SNIKT! as claws slowly extend from one Logan's hands, then mostly extend from the other. Logan i still frowning at his bad hand when--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CROWBAR THWACKS HIS SKULL. A metallic ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off balance and pissed, Logan swings at them as they converge, but he's drunk and soon they are pounding him w knives and guns and fists and a torque wrench. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries his best to keep them from the limo, catches one guy's bat an inch before it would dent the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another one of them shoots in that direction, but Logan p himself in front of the bullet. The pain from that little move stops him long enough for them to resume the pummeli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Logan's eyes go yellow, pupils dilating. He let out a long, loud yell. Fury rockets up in him, like cocai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HE STANDS AND RAMS HIS CLAWS INTO CROWBAR and kicks anoth Banger into the back of the open van. Yet another runs at Logan only to get gored in the neck and tossed. This is r work for Logan, not easy. And it is fueled by rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jitters again raises his sawed-off, he will nail the car sure, but Logan slices off his arm above the elbow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadly for Logan, the hand, while disconnected from the bo it once belonged to, is still holding the gun. So, as it the dirt, the gun goes off, putting several pellet-sized holes in the door of the limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This, more than anything else, doubles Logan anger--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHO GETS HIT ONCE MORE --and then goes after the last ban who, seeing he had his chance, leaps into the van and spi out of the lot, his wounded compadre in back, spilling on the dirt as the van bounces back onto the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan picks up his keys, some loose change and a single silver bullet. He stands, staring at the holes in his otherwise pristine stretch as RAIN BEGINS TO FALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sucks in deep breaths, forcing himself to regain contr His eyes return to normalcy. A PHONE VIBRATES OS. Logan t out his, looks at it (he's got a fare), kicks the jack fr the under the chassis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE CRANE UP as Logan starts up the stretch and makes a lo in the lot, taking care to run over the three remaining Bangers before laying rubber onto the highway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's asleep, Burt. Sleep- walking! Hostages! No one cares!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOGAN cruises the wet El Paso streets. LCD Billboards for chemically enhanced life. Gang graffiti on self-driving buses. A kaleidoscope of moments, dark and mundane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't see the connection? Tween the ice caps, pornographers, debt, mutants, poisoned water, it's all-В­

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colored lights play against A TAXI & LIMO ID. Logan's over the name: "JAMES HOWLETT"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde, its 2026! We're talkin `bout a hostage crisis and you're talkin' mutants? That's history, pal. Trey in Galveston, you're on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat throbs through the partition. Logan's eyes flick t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOUR INEBRIATED PROM BOYS in back, in pastel tuxes. Three them stand on the bench looking out the sunroof. They how and shout, "rapping" with the now blasting music, waving rain-soaked Hispanics at a HEAVILY GUARDED BORDER GATE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE-- LOGAN as he endures the torture, jaw clenched, br lights on his face as WE CUT TO :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wet and bullet-riddled from the altercation with the Bang Logan grabs a "back-up" suit from the trunk. He holds it not in the best shape, but will have to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PROM TEENS in the back suck vape sticks and laugh. Tw get it on. One pitches forward and yells over the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Driver, you got any Bang in this whip?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan pretends he can't hear. Instead, his gaze shifts to passenger visor, and what's tucked there:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PAGE FROM A SPANISH PENNY SAVER -- a USED 70 FT. SUNSEE docked in the Gulf of Mexico, LA SERENATA painted on its transom. Scrawled below: "Asking $60K."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan stares hard at the image of the boat. Takes a cente breath -- when the TEEN BEGINS KNOCKING on the partition. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo - Driver!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Bitch is deaf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan cleans up at the sink. Allows a couple slugs to pop from his (slowly healing) wounds as he changes into a cle suit. Looks at himself in the mirror. HIS PHONE BUZZES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to work, old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan waits with other drivers as muffled off screen "hallelujahs!" ring out O.S. He looks at a large screen T where the crowd can be seen, hands raised, praising God. Everywhere are similar words in a "trademarked" design--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "You are God's plan!" "We are God's plan!" "Be Part of God's plan!" "His plan!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Logan notices, across the street--

dialogues.speaker: A FIAT WITH MEXICAN PLATES AND A BAD HEADLIGHT DOUBLE PAR
dialogues.text: The driver, a Woman inside watching him. A child in back red jacket watches him too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN OLD LADY and her HUSBAND, both in failing health, ride clinging to "God's Plan" Merchandise. The Old Lady looks the window at the lost souls on the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't we lock the doors?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're locked, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan watches as her husband takes her hand. Then, Logan notices-- THE FIAT WITH MEXICAN PLATES. He makes a quick turn, the old folks sliding to one side. He's lost them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan in f.g., tossing out some trash as A PASTOR speaks grieving assemblage over a grave. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Returning to his limo, Logan watches THE BEREAVED FAMILY, drawn in spite of himself: how they mourn the loss of the own, how they console each other--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to face A DISHEVELED HISPANIC WOMAN, 35. She sta about twenty paces from THE BATTERED FIAT WITH ONE HEADLI wipers on. Logan eyes the woman, wild-eyed, dirty raincoa gets a big whiff of "crazy."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I knew it was you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan moves past her, heads for his limo in line with oth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. I'm in trouble. You're the only one who can help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan looks at her as THE MOURNERS (his clients) come dow the hill toward the line of black vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a hero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan laughs as he pulls an umbrella from his trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't we all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to his clients, holding the umbrella over a sobb widow, escorting her to the door of his limo. The Hispani woman just stands there, rain soaking her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell happened to you?! What are you hiding from?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Logan falls behind the wheel, he checks his clients in rear view and that's when there is a sudden screech--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FIAT makes a fast U-turn, nearly sideswiping him. And it swerves away, Logan glimpses THE FIGURE in the back window. THE DARK-HAIRED GIRL IN A RED SLICKER, face a blu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE AS-- Logan pulls his stretch into a spot at A HOSPIT EMERGENCY ROOM ENTRANCE. He hurries through the rain, mee A LARGE MAN IN ORDERLY SCRUBS, smoking a vape under a can Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two talk for a moment, Logan hands the man cash and t man toys with handing Logan a bag, pulls it away, demandi more money. They argue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVERSE TO REVEAL-- A MAN IN A JEEP, WATCHING through the rain, HIS METAL HAND ON THE WHEEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan, now carrying the bag, hurries through the rain to Limo. He climbs inside starts it up but is startled by th back door opening and closing. Logan spins to face --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SMILING MAN in the back of his stretch. This is Donald Pierce, 35. A southern boy, smooth and playful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I live and breathe. The Wolverine. And he's a junkie now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know, you got some buckshot in your door. (plays with the liquor bottles in back) I heard you were in Phoenix. Food's better there by the way. But then, last night, some friends in Texas H-P called, told me they found three dead cholos in a pullout out on 54. Not unusual, except one was missing a hand. Another a leg. Multiple parallel lacerations. Slashes, femoral, thoracic. So, they're thinking it was either an escaped Tiger or Freddy Krueger... but neither of those can drive, one being fictional the other extinct. And since the wheel lugs they found belong to a `24 Gauntlet--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has she found you yet? ...Gabriela? (off Logan's blank look) See, I'm not looking for you, mutey. Not really. I'm looking for someone who's looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She took something of mine. Something for which I am responsible. When I wasn't looking. Mexican lady. Long hair, long legs, Long gone. Has her sights on you. (off Logan's glare) No bells?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know any Gabriela. So get the fuck out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce just smiles, unfazed, then shifts his gaze to Loga bag of pills. Peering in, quasi-conspiratorial:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you're hiding, amigo. Cue ball south of the border?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan tenses, says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little ...cooperation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flicks a business card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she does find you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Pierce exits. Crosses in the rain to a Custom Ram Tr Logan looks to the card:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRANSIGEN RESEARCH, A DIVISION OF ALKALI

dialogues.speaker: A HUGE FUCKING WALL. "YOU ARE NOW LEAVING THE UNITED STAT
dialogues.text: says the sign mounted on top of it. Brown muted light pus through the haze over the factories on the Mexican side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An agitated Logan in border traffic, talking on his phone he eyes the CAMERAS watching him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Espiranza, yes, I know I said June, but I want the boat now. Yes. Why does that mean the price go up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I know you wanted seventy, but I am telling you I have 45 cash now. Just bring it to port in Baja.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The seller HANGS UP. Logan sighs. Logan squints at the Pe Saver on his seat, a listing for a Sunseeker circled when CAR HORN blares. Logan inches forward moving past--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A semi pulling A LIVESTOCK TRAILER loaded with sad lookin horses. EL RIO MEATS painted on the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BORDER AGENT nods cheerfully at Logan, recognizing him. Waves him on. And that's when we see --

dialogues.speaker: THE WOMAN FROM THE CEMETERY, (GABRIELA)
dialogues.text: BEHIND THE WHEEL OF HER FIAT. At a distance. She consider following him, then swings her car around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan drives through littered Mexican streets. Cinderbloc structures pocked with bullet holes, metal shutters pulle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He merges onto Highway 45, heading for the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vista of dirt, bisected by train tracks and fence. Loga slows as he approaches A GATE. Beyond the gate, AN ABANDO SMELTING PLANT. Logan exits, pulls keys, unlocks the gate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CART WITH A PROPANE TANK STOPS as the limo comes up the road. Camera reveals the cart is pushed by A TALL MAN in wide hat, sunglasses and gloves. He wipes his ghost-pale brow. This is CALIBAN, an albino mutant in his 60's with than a passing resemblance to Edvard Munch's THE SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WINDOWS ARE PAPERED TO KEEP OUT SUNLIGHT. Caliban, glasses, hat and gloves off, prepares a tray of food as L enters. From somewhere, the sound of AN OLD MAN SHOUTING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's having a bad day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all bad days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan tosses Caliban the bag. He peers in. Logan crosses find something to eat. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needed these six hours ago. This is not enough, you know. It won't last through the week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caliban puts the bag of meds back in Logan's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan sighs and crosses toward a cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, he told me last night he's communicating with someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caliban follows. The old man's voice getting louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not talking with anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be so sure. He had all these details. I thought that tank was supposed to provide some sort of barrier. It's got all these cracks in it. What good is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving down a corridor, Logan opens a cabinet beside AN EXTERIOR DOOR. Pulls out a box of SYRINGE KITS and restoc the pills and a vial of liquid from the bag. Loads a syri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been asking questions again. He's trying to read my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what these are for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan swings open the door and Caliban dodges the sudden blast of sunlight as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan crosses beneath a catwalk toward A HUGE ROUND PLATE TANK pitched over on its side. The old man's voice gettin louder. He spins open the hatch and steps inside-- Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan enters the space and find himself facing, AN OLD MA A WHEELCHAIR making circles around mattress. CHARLES XAVI in his 90s. Bearded, tufts of white on his pate. A small radio plays music with alligator clips to a car battery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friends, I have Good News today! It's not about what you do. It's not about your deeds. You can't live up to his rules. God knows you can't. That's OK! We're imperfect!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan steps over a dumped tray of food, approaches Charle with the meds. Charles swings his chair around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make way, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan steps into his path and Charles stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said make way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new Quesalupa from Taco Bell. Get it with chicken, get it with steak. But with cheese baked right in the shell it's the next big--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sees the syringe) The man who puts me to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could both use some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan proceeds to roll up Charles' sleeve, but Charles resists and they struggle for control of the needle--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles, you're making this--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles lunges for the needle and as Logan pulls it away, CHARLES FALLS OUT OF THE CHAIR to the floor. He looks up Logan, enraged. A RINGING SOUND begins to rise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you fucking doing to me!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tremor suddenly shakes Charles' body. And now Logan is with a PSIONIC BLAST. THE RINGING LOUD AND UNBEARABLE, li fork scraping his brain. Charles eyes are now blood red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caliban, headed back to the kitchen, suddenly fights a ki of induced paralysis, struggling to move, breathe--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan, pushing through the pain, pulls out the syringe an INJECTS Charles. The medication immediately takes effect, subduing the wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caliban is released as well, gulping for air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles lies still, staring up at Logan who shakes off th effects of the wave, the ringing fading. He reaches down picks up the disoriented old man--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have I been here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan carries him to the bed and sets him down. Charles l around, in tears. Logan doesn't answer, dumps two pills i his palm which he transfers to Charles' hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember what they are. The shots mellow the seizures, the pills keep them from happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles stares at the pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How `bout you blow on them to make them safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles looks up at Logan. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off, Logan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you know who I am now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always know who you are. Sometimes I just don't recognize you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles pops them in his mouth, swallows them. Logan star to clean up the spilled dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you leave me alone with that fucking Albino... he won't listen to me. I know a damn speciation when I see one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A speciation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new mutant. A young one. There are forces trying to kill them! They need help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad you're not in that business anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want your help, not mine. (off Logan's look) Oh, yes. That's how fucking stupid they are. They're waiting for you. At the Statue of Liberty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Statue of Liberty was a long time ago, Charles. A long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan crosses to the old man. Takes in the worry on his f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no new mutants. Hasn't been a new one born in twenty-five years. Not anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles looks off. The drugs mercifully tugging at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan pulls the quilt over the old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always thought we were part of God's Plan. Maybe we were just God's mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles touches Logan's face. A tender moment until--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a disappointment you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan takes this in. Stung.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I found you, you were pursuing a career as a "cage fighter".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not in the mood for bedtime--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A warm capper to life as an assassin, hooked on barbiturates. (smiles, dark) You were an animal, but we took you in. I gave you a family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gone now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan eyes him a hard beat, then turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer me! Why are we here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Logan ignores him, moving for the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one should have to live this way! Drugged! In a fucking tank!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for your own good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. NO it's NOT! You're waiting for me to die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan spins the hatch wheel, entombing the old man. He walks away as the yelling continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink new Hypno Plus! Fortified with seven nutrients and Extacine 5, for energy and vitality!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SERIES OF SHOTS-- Logan on his back, unable to sleep, t sun hitting his face through a soot covered window as he stares hard at the Penny Saver boat listings: La Serenata

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses the Pennysaver. Paces like a panther. Shirtless scarred. He stops, looks at his right hand, flexes it, st arthritic, knuckles swollen, the slits moist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He forces his claws out. They come slow. Painfully. Middl one lagging. He grabs the middle claw with his other hand pulls it hard, slicing into his palm, blood flowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stumbling in fading light, his palm wrapped with a rag, L drinks from a bottle and stares at the fading light as he hears Charles calling his name in the great pitched tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan lets the water run over his scars and swollen joint Bullet wounds are closed but still visible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan dresses in his chauffeur blacks. His hand shakes ma it hard to button his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan enters, finds Caliban sorting laundry... Logan pour himself a coffee, falls in a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to fight but we need to talk about these things. There are things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. Would it be considered nagging if repeated my observation that the dose is too low. To suppress the seizures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes a near an empty pill bottle and puts it on the table. Logan examines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what the guy gave me. I wasn't in a position to make demands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I almost died this morning. That seizure was a--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't even a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It felt a lot longer than a minute. I couldn't breathe. I was in a terrible state. You're less affected, Logan-- Please don't give me that look. You know he needs a higher dose. And I know you've got more money squirreled away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A red light blinks on the loading dock. Logan glares at Caliban as a rumble rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That money's to get us out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not us. You and him. You're saving up for a bloody Sunseeker. I don't see myself hiding below deck like Nosferatu, doing laundry, do you? ...Folding your underwear. Making pigs in a blanket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out another window we see-- A FREIGHT TRAIN PASSES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caliban crosses with his tea, holding something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was in your pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caliban sniffs a gleaming bullet, sets it down. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adamantium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan snatches it. Looks at Caliban. Don't go here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're thinking of blowing your brains out, please wait till you're out on the high seas. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need this right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A year ago, you asked me to help you. And God knows I try but I can't help you, not really, if you don't talk to me. I hear you at night. You aren't sleeping. You don't want to talk about that. Or the booze you're drinking or the pus you keep wiping from your knuckles or the blood I wash from your clothes or those brand new holes in your chest, that haven't healed. And I very much doubt you want to talk about the fact that you can't read the label on the side of that bottle. (re: the vial) It's Ibuprofen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan stares at the bottle, humiliated. Suddenly, he kick back his chair and, off Caliban's nervous expression, sla his cup out of his hands. It shatters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was my favorite mug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan crosses to his coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's happening to you, Logan. On the inside. I can smell it. You're sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan moves toward the exit, eyes aflame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're supposed to be leading us somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music blasts. Logan drives five bawdy bridesmaids. They l and shout. One grins at him, FLASHES HIM as he pulls into their destination. Logan hustles outside, holding the doo they start to stumble out pushing tips as him. That's whe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIS PHONE BUZZES-- Logan squints at what looks like a new fare as the last bridesmaid exits. He reaches in his coat pulls out READING GLASSES (A Walgreens tag still on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The address on the phone -- 3300 Marquez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan pulls his limo into a lot fronting a small twentiet century motel next to the freeway. 3300 Marquez. A neon STATUE OF LIBERTY looms overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan gets out of the car and takes in the sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks to the OFFICE and sees A WOMAN, (THE MANAGER) a lady, tinted hair, thinning, in flip flops, smoking a vap Logan hears a BOUNCE BOUNCE BOUNCE and turns to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he walks into the courtyard, he can see that she is br skinned, dark-eyed, staring at him, standing by THE FIAT THE BROKEN LIGHT, calmly bouncing a ball. Once in a while bounces it off the side of the motel, catching it crisply

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senor Logan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan turns and sees THE HISPANIC WOMAN FROM THE GRAVEYAR standing in the door of one of the rooms, holding a suitc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. ...We need a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she steps out of the room, we see that she is weak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to go) Not available. Call a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not crazy. My name is Gabriela Lopez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to know your name!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are men after us. They almost got us today. We need to get to North Dakota. There, we can cross. To Canada.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone can do that job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It has to be you. I'll give you fifty thousand dollars

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you find me? Huh?! `Cause you are fucking up my life, lady. The people after you are on my ass now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Sightings... were posted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sightings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On chat rooms. People said someone looked like The Wolverine was in El Paso, driving. Said he looked old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And by people, you mean fat fucktards living in their parents' basements playing with dolls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever it was, they were right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has a point. THE SOUND OF SHATTERING GLASS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE GIRL IN THE SLICKER HAS SMASHED a motel window with h ball. The Manager advances on her with a broom. The girl stares, fascinated and perhaps amused by the angry woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wipe that smile off your face, Missy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you to stop it with that ball. Bad girl. Mamacita is gonna have to pay for that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Please. Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriela falls face down on the pavement. The girl runs t her but freezes when Logan looks up at her. He kneels dow Sees blood staining Gabriela's raincoat sleeve. BULLET WO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have to pay for damages. She's got cash. I seen it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your fat ass back in your office. You'll get your money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MOTEL MANAGER flees to her office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicked, terrified) Don't let her call anyone. They will find us. They will kill us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan helps Gabriela to the bed. He takes in the mess of files, print outs, clippings, toys. He notices a medical Cracks it open, fully stocked, looks at Gabriela.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I`m a nurse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was. In Mexico City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan watches as Gabriela lifts her sleeve, takes things the kit, ministering to her wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did that happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This morning. Near the border. I got away from them. But they know my car now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches for the NIGHT STAND, pries open its cheap sid paneling, and pulls out a bloody envelope hidden there. H it to Logan. There's an address on the outside and a set numbers beneath it. Inside, bundles of greenbacks. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it. Please. Bring us to this address. It's twenty thousand. You can have thirty more when we get there. My friends will--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My boyfriend. He wants to kill me. And take her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He eyes the girl standing in the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriela and the girl exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to hurt her. (takes Logan's hand) I know you are still good inside. I know you want to help. (looks in his eyes) Please. There won't be any problems. Not if we leave now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't leave right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to be there Friday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or we miss our chance. To cross. (a coughing fit, then) Our... family. They will be there that day. No other day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan glances at the girl and back to Gabriela. The money his hand. Enough to buy the boat. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can get you there Friday. But I need to go home first, take care of some things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring us with you. Please. We can help with whatever you need to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan moves to the door. Gabriela sobs, closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back in a few hours. (looks at the girl) Keep this locked. And tell your mommy I know she's lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan exits and we move CLOSE ON-- THE GIRL. She crosses the window, looking out like a sentinel, as Logan's limo drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan pulls in. The trunk pops open and Logan walks aroun and grabs several bags from the back. Then slams it close

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Caliban goes through all of the GROCERIES Logan has brought. Steaks. Ice Cream. Cereal. Bourbon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me you didn't rob a bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan tosses him a white paper bag. Caliban looks inside- it's stuffed full of meds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you did rob a bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a job that's gonna pay enough to change things. But I have to go away. For a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caliban takes this in, watches as Logan opens a Tequila bottle and continue out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caliban pokes his head out into the desert night, watchin Logan heading toward Charles' tank. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan finishes giving Charles his pills, lays him down on bed. Charles is a bit dazed. Logan's phone buzzes. He pop his new eyeglasses, looks down at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE TEXT READS -- "Please hurry."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like those. They make you look younger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan types back, "On my way." Caliban arrives in the hatchway, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles. Listen. I gotta go for a few days. I got a long ride for some good money. When I get back, we're getting out of here, okay. Gonna drive down to Yelapa and get ourselves a boat. Live on the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And... you'll be safe there? From the people after you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan meets Charles' eyes. He looks to Caliban in the doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'll be safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles looks up at him, pleased. Logan considers his old friend, then heads for the hatch, moving past Caliban.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan pulls into the lot. Everything peaceful and wet. A glows in the manager's office. Logan crosses to the door Gabriela's room. He knocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he gets no answer, his eyes finding the splintered wo around the doorjamb. He pushes the door open... Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room has been trashed. Blood everywhere. The bed is empty. Gabriela is tied to a chair, eyes unblinking, face blue, body riddled with bullets and cuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan makes a sweep of the room. Then recalls --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NIGHT STAND. Pries the side panel free. There, wedged the gap-- A PHONE IN A PINK CASE. He takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sees her last text was to him. "Please hurry..." He pockets the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan closes the door behind him and steps into the rain, scanning the lot. No sign of the girl anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down, noticing gouges on the concrete, slashes, filling with rain and blood. Then he spots --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLOODY CYBORG FINGER on the pavement. High Tech. Severe the knuckle, wires trailing. He picks it up. The fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIRENS BEGINS TO RISE. He quickly crosses to his car, now noticing the MOTEL MANAGER DEAD BY THE VENDING MACHINES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan barrels through the gate and screeches to a stop. Gets out and heads for the small structure behind the tan that contains his bedroom--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello! Logan! --What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caliban rounds the corner in his big hat and goggles, approaching from his "garden" with a bunch of beets. Loga starts to climb the steps but turns as Caliban follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did something go wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving away again) The job was wrong to begin with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caliban turns away with a sigh, heading to the main build Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll close your trunk. --I'm making borscht for Charles if you want some. He got dressed for lunch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is when Logan pauses and comes back down the steps looking out to his limo, TRUNK OPEN, Caliban approaching

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caliban reaches, ABOUT TO SHUT THE TRUNK-- WHEN LOGAN'S H STOPS HIM. Logan peers inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CHILD'S BACKPACK. He grabs it. Unzips it. MEDICAL FILES COMIC BOOKS. A PLASTIC HORSE. Other trinkets. Then he not something in the trunk bed. A RUBBER BALL. The girl's bal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Who does that belong to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's when Logan hears a sound and looks to-- A JEEP APPROACHING ON THE HORIZON. Pierce's Jeep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you supposed to see shit coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a glorified truffle pig, not a clairvoyant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go inside. Keep Charles quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go. Inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caliban shuffles away as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan watches the JEEP TURN ONTO THE GROUNDS and come to stop in a dust cloud. Donald Pierce climbs out in a windbreaker. He approaches, taking in the property.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to turn around, asshole. This is private property.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs, comes closer) Yes, it is. In fact, I believe it belongs to a multinational smelting company based in Shanghai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you keeping the old man? In there? Or there. I'd like to meet him. I'm told HSA classifies his brain as a weapon of mass destruction now. `Damned shame, what happened back east.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been dead for a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce doesn't look convinced. Or all that interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One that goes with that ball you're holding. That's special rubber, you know. Coated with something called J-Tek. Gets in through the skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very calming. Like Magnesium but without the side effects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You feel calmer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no girl here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another laugh, then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you went to the motel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was called there. There was no girl. Just the woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The woman".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such as she was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you saw Gabriela but you didn't call me? (sticks out lower lip) That hurts. Say, you didn't shoot the poor thing, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked you first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. (laughs; then dead serious) I wish you had called me, Logan. Like I asked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man takes a step closer and Logan grabs him by the ar Feels something there and looks at the man who smiles... PIERCE HAS A CYBORG ARM. Ending in a gleaming, metal hand cyborg hand missing a finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See. You're not the only one who's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of nowhere A SOUND A LOT LIKE A BOOMERANG as A LEAD P -- THWAP -- HITS PIERCE IN THE HEAD-- AND DOWN HE GOES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan turns, stunned to see--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE GIRL standing by an out-building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Logan, THEN SUDDENLY WINGS ANOTHER PIPE AT H Logan watches it come and CATCHES IT, about to wing it ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan turns to see Charles in his chair at the door of th main building. Looks better than usual. Caliban behind hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan. Caliban. This is Laura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He then smiles at the girl...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been waiting for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He motions for her to come inside. Caliban looks to Logan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way, child. Come here, Laura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl (LAURA) crosses, snatches her backpack from Loga then steps over Pierce and crosses to Charles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bewildered, Logan kneels pulls a GUN from Pierce's waistb He hands it to Caliban who lands beside him, taking in th cyborg hand and the tattoo on Pierce's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like Ex-military. Maybe a bounty hunter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Caliban Don Pierce's business card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caliban reads Alkali on the card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's by himself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him back in his ride. Drive him to the wash and dump him. Then take the car into Juarez, leave it for the vultures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he wakes up before I get there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Caliban the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Text me where you are and we'll pick you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan enters with a duffle, shoving supplies in it. He

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles sits beside "Laura" as she ravenously eats a bowl cereal. Charles speaks to her gently. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did what you could, Laura. (she looks at him) Well. Yes. Of course, it's painful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan eyes LAURA'S BACKPACK which she keeps close. He gra it but Laura stands, holding the strap. Logan shoves her down. She grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get it back-- after I figure out what you and your mother have got us into.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan peers in her bag, notices files, a toy horse and co book. He winces, looks up as Charles wheels over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't her mother you met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So she talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're communicating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hands him pills) Take them-- Now. (goes back to packing) We have to go. Leave. It isn't safe here anymore. And you can't have an attack out there. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (swallows the pills) She's the mutant I told you about. The one we have to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not a mutant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crossing to a duffel) What's her gift, eating? Pipe throwing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan is interrupted by A LOUD RUMBLE AS THE NIGHTLY FREI TRAIN APPROACHES. Laura bolts up from the table. Charles reaches out for her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright, Laura. It's only a train. A choo choo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods to the monitor. We see the FREIGHT TRAIN passing the distance. She stares at it. Like she's never seen one

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caliban at the wheel, in gloves and sun hat. The gun Loga gave him on the dash. He pulls to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caliban drags an unconscious Pierce out of the car. He mo to exit, crosses to close the jeep's rear hatch when he H A SOFT RUMBLE. He looks off and sees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL TERRAIN VEHICLES IN THE DISTANCE. Lots of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caliban turns back to see Pierce standing by the driver d Grinning... He reaches for the gun on the dash and cocks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fucked now, mutey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Logan shoves the last of the packed bags, and whatever else he's grabbed, into the trunk. THE SAME RUMBLE. He lo up at -- a cloud of silt rising on the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Laura hears the rumble and stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright. It's just another--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming in the door) --it's not a train. We gotta go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out the window, FOUR BLACK FEDERALE TRUCKS approach in a cloud of dust. Armed men in black hang onto the vehicles. Behind the trucks, THE SAME FOUR LARGE CUSTOM ALL TERRAIN VEHICLES. A different type of men are on board these, mercenaries, in full tactical gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOTE -- We'll call the mercenaries riding   behind the Federales, THE REAVERS. They outclass the   Federales wit their weapons, vehicles, armor and skill.   Many have weaponized appendages where missing limbs   should be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan takes hold of Charles' wheelchair, pushing him to t door. He passes Laura, points at her, an order:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he wheels out) Don't be afraid, child. He'll come back for you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Logan, not so sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan wheels a bouncing Charles rapidly out the door over gravel and rocks toward the limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...bloody hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE RUMBLE GETS LOUDER and Logan and Charles look up as-- VEHICLES SMASH THROUGH THE GATE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as Logan lifts him into the back of the limo, throws t wheelchair in the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan quickly unzips his duffel, grabs something else. Th Federales almost upon them. Charles yells at Logan as he slams the trunk and returns to Charles' door. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan! You have to go back for her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not our problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan grabs a seat belt and hurriedly straps Charles in.. and doing so, surreptitiously pulls out a loaded hypoderm and jams it into the old man's (numb) thigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you just did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan jumps behind the wheel, turns it over, hits the gas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOGAN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the opposite direction, THREE MORE TRUCKS LOADED WIT FEDERALES and FOUR MERCENARIES ON DIRT BIKES, BLOCK THEM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan stomps on the brakes and SLIDES TO A STOP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door opens and Donald Pierce steps out of his truck, hi suit now dusted from his earlier misadventure. Around him FEDERALES AND REAVERS ALL train their guns on the limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jumping off one of the Federale Jeeps, A MEXICAN COMMANDE chest decorated with mid-level brass, orders his men to t tactical positions surrounding the structures. He barks orders in Spanish and holds a police sketch of Laura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Este es el mutante! Capturar o matar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura sits at the table. She refills her bowl with cereal eats it methodically with her spoon, watching the stand-o outside through the windows like a TV show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan watches as Pierce walks toward their limo.   Charle getting fuzzier in back, the meds kicking in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raises a finger, dreamily) The child, Logan. We mustn't forget Laura. ...Logan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyeing Pierce approaching) Please be quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce arrives at the driver's side window, sees Charles back, smiles down at the old man smiling back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Charles Xavier. The most wanted octogenarian in North America--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan shoves the door open into Pierce, knocking him back

dialogues.speaker: THE SOUND OF MANY GUNS CLICKING AS THE FEDERALES TRAIN
dialogues.text: WEAPONS ON LOGAN. But Logan gets in Pierce's face, fiery:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Caliban?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rolls down window, loopy) Excuse me. I'm a nonagenarian, actually...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about you tell me where the girl is first. Or maybe I ought to ask the cue ball. Seems friendly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, she's not here. Where's Caliban?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce smirks, amused by Logan's anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left him in the same hole you were going to leave me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan loses it, lunges for him -- when someone hits Logan from behind. Hard. And again. As Logan falls to his knees turns-- SNIKT-- AND SEPARATES A REAVER from his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got extra barbecue tongs for this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FEDERALE COMMANDER nods. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: AND A SWARM OF FEDERALES ATTACK LOGAN WITH RIFLE BUTTS AN
dialogues.text: BOOTS AND BEAT HIM TO THE GROUND. There are too many.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pummeled, overwhelmed, his limbs all pinned, Logan turns to find PIERCE'S FOOT TO HIS THROAT. Pierce leans down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. Seeing you this way, Wolverine, it breaks my heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as I rip it out of your chest, fuck-stick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce smiles, then nods to one of the Reavers (Mohawk) w jumps off his bike and advances toward a side door of the Smelting Plant. He's carrying a STEEL RESTRAINING COLLAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Federale Commander shouts to Pierce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one goes in without Federale escort. I am in charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mohawk pauses. The Commander dispatches two of his Federa to lead him inside, weapons drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DOOR OPENS as MOHAWK AND THE TWO FEDERALES creep into dark room adjacent to the kitchen, advancing toward--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura at the kitchen table, her back to them. She seems oblivious as she pours more cereal, eats with her spoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the Federales accidentally kicks a bottle and Laur pauses her spoon in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON LOGAN, watching. Charles, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY, THERE ARE SCREAMS FROM INSIDE THE STRUCTURE. Me screams. Then it is quiet. Everyone turns as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creeaaak. A STEEL DOOR OPENS WIDE. LAURA steps from the d into the blazing light. She SQUINTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce steps off Logan, having found his quarry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That-a-girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and now LAURA BOOTS SOMETHING which rolls to Pierce's f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce and the Federale Commander look down at-- A SEVERED HEAD. WITH A MOHAWK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Laura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON LOGAN -- Pulling himself up from the ground as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAURA-- continues walking toward Pierce. Hands at her sid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura. Stay where you are. You want to see your friends, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON PIERCE-- as he nods to the REAVERS to prepare to take

dialogues.speaker: A CYBORG-LEGGED REAVER OPENS THE DOORS OF A CONTAINMENT T
dialogues.text: in back of one of their vehicles. Yet another REAVER (PRE BOY, not) assembles A SAVAGE HARPOON AND RESTRAINT SYSTEM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the Federale Commander suddenly orders his men to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomar el mutante!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander, stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said alive or dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura! NO! NO!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON LOGAN-- He reacts to the claws. In shock. Cannot belie what he's seeing. With the attention on Laura, Logan star moving, limping, back to the limo. His eyes meet--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura's. A moment of mutual recognition. It breaks as she turns to face the Federales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON CHARLES-- who, struggling against the meds, presses himself against the glass, staring at Laura. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...My Lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACK TO LAURA AS -- THE FEDERALES LUNGE AT HER and, sadly them, Laura leaps in the air and becomes a whirling dervi of death. Limbs and weapons sliced from her attackers lik topiary. Guns fire to no effect as Laura evades the shots

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This little girl has been created, designed and trained f one thing and one thing only: killing. And she's a virtuo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This wave dispatched, LAURA FLEES, HIDES BEHIND THE CATWA SUPPORTS. The armed Federales hunt for her among the supp and she starts picking them off, one by one, with her bla and even with their own guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Laura is pinned against a concrete wall by A MU BOUND REAVER. With an acrobatic move, she boots him in th nuts and leaps over him, manages to run as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRETTY BOY FIRES THE HARPOON GUN, retracts the cable and her to the ground. REAVERS AND FEDERALES SURROUND HER and PRETTY BOY is about to put on the restraints when--

dialogues.speaker: SNIKT
dialogues.text: OTHERS as Laura pulls the harpoon from her side and runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura is grabbed by THREE MORE REAVERS, WHO RESTRAIN HER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO ADAMANTIUM FOOT CLAWS EMERGE FROM HER FEET dragging o the concrete, making a ringing sound, like chalk on a bla board and -- suddenly -- with a double scissor-kick -- sh stabs one Reaver in the thigh and the other in the throat her gleaming foot claw sticking out the back of his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan stares, slack-jawed. Then notices--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIERCE AND ANOTHER REAVER are moving on the limo, about t take Charles. Logan tosses them back and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan drops behind the wheel, watching through the windsh as Laura takes on six or seven more hostiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drunk with the meds) ...As I said, Logan, she's a mutant... Like you. Very much like you, in fact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan grimly starts the engine. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan ignores Charles as he put the limo in gear, gaining speed, and then-- MAKES A HARD U-TURN AND --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan accelerates again, Laura clinging to the hood. Loga punches a button, opening the sunroof as gunfire starts t hit their limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura leaps into the limo. Charles smiles at her, pleased seemingly oblivious to the gunfire:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they take a hard turn, a side window shatters and LAUR INSTINCTIVELY SHIELDS CHARLES FROM THE BULLETS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAURA GETS HIT AND matter of factly sucks the slug out of arm and spits it on the seat like Lee Marvin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan meets eyes with Charles in his rear view. And that' when they are hit with A BARRAGE OF BULLETS--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FEDERALES HAVE LEAPT INTO THEIR JEEPS and fire at Log limo as they spin out in the dirt, in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disgusted, Pierce also gets behind the wheel and leads hi Reavers in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PLANT GATE BLOCKED BY THE ARMADA OF VEHICLES, Logan drives straight at the chainlink fence-- and we prepare f classic action movie fence smash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on!

dialogues.speaker: BUT THE LIMO HITS THE FENCE, BENDS THE SUPPORTS AND GRIND
dialogues.text: A PATHETIC HALT, TANGLED IN MESH. As it would in real lif

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Federales open fire at the limo as Logan guns the engine reverse, trying to get traction on the dirt. Other Federa speed toward them on motorcycles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under massive fire, bullet-riddled, Logan's limo finds purchase, and he's backing out at high speed, ripping a l section of chain link from its posts and dragging this "t with him (driving backwards now). Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN SWERVES HARD AND THE CHAIN LINK "TAIL" SWINGS OUT A
dialogues.text: WIPES OUT THE REAVER BIKES. One of the riders tumbles and grabs onto the chain link tail, the limo dragging him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Reaver claws his way along the chain link toward the of the car, drawing his gun, firing at the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan ducks and spins the car around. The dragging fence swings wide, LOSING THE REAVER ON THE FENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce angrily peels his truck in another direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan sees the main gate ahead. As he guns for it, he not THE FLASHING RED TRAIN-WARNING LIGHTS at the loading dock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO FEDERALE JEEPS reach the sides of the limo, guns aime squarely at Logan. Laura and Charles react as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan steers the limo through a series of concrete struct FORCING THE JEEPS INTO VIOLENT COLLISIONS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan guns his limo into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HULKING FREIGHT TRAIN arriving quickly from parallel tracks. The train is moving faster than the limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan makes a hard left, cranking the wheel just clipping front corner of Pierce's truck, spinning toward the track

dialogues.speaker: THE LIMO PLOWS STRAIGHT INTO THE SIDE OF A FEDERALE TRUCK
dialogues.text: which gets squeezed between the limo and train. Sparks fl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOGAN SPINS THE WHEEL, PUSHING THE TRUCK (and the Federal Commander in it) INTO THE PATH OF THE TRAIN AS--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOGAN'S LIMO COMES TO A STOP ON THE OTHER SIDE. Logan loo back through the moving freight cars at--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce and the remaining Reavers, stuck until it passes. It's a long train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan's battered limo racing at 120 mph. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan's eyes darting to his rearview, peeled for any sign Reavers. He glances back at --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAURA, beside Charles, her gaze fixed out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura slowly turns, acknowledging Logan's existence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who she is, Logan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does she remind you of anybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura holds Logan's glare with her own equally hard look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan flares, peers tensely back out the windshield as he takes a hard turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donald Pierce steps over a mangled Reaver as the remainin "soldiers" clean up after the fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave nothing behind fellas. We were not here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks toward the main building, then looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring me the tracker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce steps inside and takes in the room. Picks up the R SLICKER on the chair. Finds her ball in the pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns as the DOOR IS OPENED and A SERIOUSLY INJURED CALIBAN is carried inside and shoved into a chair. He's hooked up to an IV, his head is covered with a HOOD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce rips off the hood and slaps Caliban's battered fac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wakey wakey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caliban blinks his pale eyes open. Pierce sits down acros from him and smiles. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I read about you when I was a kid. You tracked that crazy gilled mutey fishy motherfuck, what was his name, Wave? (flutters his metal digits) Tracked him halfway `cross the Atlantic they said. And you was underwater. Inside a sub. And you found him anyway. Shit. That's a gift. That's trackin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I believe you're thinking of someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce grins. SUDDENLY STRIKES Caliban with his metal han

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'I'm not mistaken, you used to work for my team, for the good guys. You were helping round up all the old mutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caliban says nothing. Pierce picks up Laura's ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What changed? 'You got religion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce slides Laura's RED SLICKER onto the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna need you to help the good guys one more time, and track one more special for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will not. I will not help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce turns toward the blacked out kitchen window. Starts to peel at the tar paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course that's what you'd say. But then I got this theory that people don't really change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce suddenly pulls the tar paper, RELEASING A SHARD OF BRIGHT SUNLIGHT. Caliban cries out, tries to turn away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beware the light, Caliban. I bet that's what your Mommy said every day when you was a kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beware the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Reavers force his face into the bright light. The mutant's eyes open. It burns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not bring out the worst in each other. The girl's not worth it. She's not a natural fuck-up like you. She's a business mistake. R & D gone bad. There's liability. They can't have things with patents running around hurting people. So we need to get her off board before she hurts anybody else, someone you care about maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce nods to his men and they put the hood back over Caliban's head and haul him out, crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...My name is Gabriela Lopez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE SCREEN WE SEE-- A SHAKY SELFIE OF GABRIELA in a Me City apartment. She looks healthier but grim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a nurse and for ten years I have worked at Transigen research in Mexico City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On screen, we are moving through corridors of a high end research facility. See flashes of Gabriela in reflections glass, in a nurse's uniform, recording surreptitious vide

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transigen is a owned by an American company. And they pay better than any Mexican hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHAKY SHOT -- CLOSE ON letterhead from a memo -- ALKALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I am about to show you is illegal in the U.S. and Canada--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON -- A NEW SELFIE OF GABRIELA, now in a stockroom. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and that is why they came here.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: DRUGGED CHILDREN (ages 5-15) as they are prodded into ken like enclosures decorated with tattered stuffed animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These children were born in this building. They were born here and they have never left. Never seen the sun or ocean, the rain or snow or any of God's creatures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleeping mats on tile floors with exposed drains and hose Armed guards, some missing limbs, perhaps recognizable as Reavers, juxtaposed against the cheerful sound of musak. place is a cross between a Children's hospital and a kenn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have no birth certificates, no names beside the ones we have given them. They were raised in the bellies of Mexican girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grainy photos flip past, A BLOOD SPRAYED BIRTHING ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --girls no one can find anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Images of test tubes. Vials of liquids. Electron microsco

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their fathers were semillas genГ©tica, special seeds in bottles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children (5 years old) singing in Spanish over a birt cake with the Mexican staff. They are suddenly interrupte A RED HAIRED MAN IN A LAB COAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEW SHOT-- the Red Haired MAN -- corridor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surreptitiously recorded as he chastises the Mexican staf We pick up snatches of words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't bring them cake, Maria. We do not dress them up for Halloween. We do not call them baby or kiss boo boos. They're part of a study. Do not think of them as children. Think of them as things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have patents and copyrights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (throws a stapler) Comprende?

dialogues.speaker: NOW WE SEE-- SHAKY VIDEO OF TWO KIDS FIGHTING IN A PADDED
dialogues.text: ROOM. A lab technician injects one with something and tha one starts beating the other, exhibiting tremendous stren A staff member screams in Spanish and tries to break it u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They told us they were part of a pharmaceutical study.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUN RANGE, WITH PADS AND HACKED UP DUMMIES. A kid fires a automatic weapon with brutal accuracy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEW SHOT-- Children spar with MEN IN BODY ARMOR (REAVERS) Special Ops combat skills in 8 year old bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE RED HAIRED MAN, 40, watches, expressionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But of course, that was a lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON -- A SELFIE OF GABRIELA at her apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They thought we were too poor and stupid to understand. We are poor, but we are not stupid. I knew what they were doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds up SEVERAL YELLOWED NEWSPAPER ARTICLES about XM And then several XMEN comic books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was a child, I learned English from these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan and Charles in the back, rapt, watching the video o Gabriela's phone, propped on the coffee table. Logan hand Charles some pills and, after seeing him pop them in his mouth, turn back to the video. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is business. They are making soldiers. Weapons X. These are babies of mutantes muerta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The video suddenly stops. Screen goes BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there more? Play it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan puts on his reading glasses, picks up the phone, tr to get it to play again. As he does this, Charles spits o his pills and drops them in the seat crevice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Battery's dead. We need a plug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far is it? (off Logan's confusion) To North Dakota.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took that woman's money. You told her you would take the child there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan stares out the open door at--
