dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAURA, sitting solemnly in one of those "Bucking Bronco" rides as it bounces and plays a repeating fanfare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's your daughter, Logan. (off his glare) Alkali had your genetic code.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not just mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, the horse ride has stopped moving. Laura hits th button over and over, but nothing happens. She bangs on t side and, still, nothing happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna hear it. I don't want to talk about it anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to pee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan looks at him. Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON LAURA AS -- SNIKT -- A CLAW comes out. She tries to ja into the Bucking Bronco machine's coin slot. Logan grabs wrist, holds out a QUARTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last ride. Then we're leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods to the claw, she retracts it. Then she grabs the quarter from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan crosses to the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We look at a half closed handicapped stall door as Logan Charles shuffle about inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it. For God's sake I can do that myself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're not doing it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Logan wheels Charles back to the car, he looks over at bucking bronco ride. LAURA'S GONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura walks down an aisle, looking at the colorful produc She grabs a can of Pringles, starts in on it. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she stops and looks at a floor display of Hypno, Mag all the variations of "energy drinks." Laura grabs a can, opens it and takes a long drink. She's bouncing as she wa now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CLERK looks up from his phone at her eating snacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura stops at a SUNGLASS RACK, munching. Notices a pair shades. Puts them on, eats more, looking at herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo. Girlie. You gotta pay for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura looks up with her mouth full. She starts for the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Clerk blocks her way. She just looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your mommy and daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues staring. Shoves some Pringles in her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, that's enough--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swipes the Pringles can from her hand, about to take t sunglasses from her nose, when, in a terrifyingly swift m she throws the clerk to the floor, straddling him, hand o his throat the other raised-- SNIKT-- claws out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit! Oh God Jesus, No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's when a hand again grabs Laura by the wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan pushes Laura to the door turns to the clerk--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --then grabs a handful of CIGARS and A PHONE CHARGER, stealing a look at a security camera on his way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A great starry sky as the desert becomes the plains. The sits, parked along a flat stretch of Oklahoma highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura and Charles are asleep in back. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan sits up front in the darkness, legs across the benc staring at the road ahead and then at the Pennysaver clip for the boat on his visor. And the envelope of cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A billboard up ahead hypes GAMBLING AND SHOWS IN OKLAHOMA CITY, 50 miles away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a small beep. Logan sighs, looks down to Gabriel pink phone plugged into the charger. It's come to life. H raises the partition and hits play.

dialogues.speaker: WE SEE A "STAFF MEMBER" PINNED ON THE FLOOR, SKIN SMOKING
dialogues.text: his neck being gripped by a 9 year old with glowing eyes. People scream. "Leo! Basta! Basta!" The boy leans back an starts crying. The staff member is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the children became older, they became difficult to control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER SURREPTITIOUS VIDEO. A BUMPY SKINNED CHILD expert shoots an automatic weapon into target dummies in an indo range. SUDDENLY THEY TURN AND SHOOT THE INSTRUCTOR. SCREA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MOVING SHOT. THE BOY WITH GLOWING EYES is chased by security up a staircase to a rooftop. An alarm whoops. Th boy lands outside and, for a moment, breathes air and sta at Mexico City. Panicked staff yell to him in Spanish as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They taught them to kill-- but they did not remove their hearts.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER CHILD IS FORCIBLY CUFFED IN A NOW FAMILIAR RESTRA
dialogues.text: SYSTEM, hissing, spitting, VIBRATING, loose objects flyin around the room. OTHER CHILDREN WATCH. Some weep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They could not be controlled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER SHOT -- A trickle of blood runs to a drain. TILT FIND A YOUNG LAURA IN A SMOCK, seemingly drugged, SITTING the floor of a tiled room. She stares at her arm as she c it with a metal claw, then watches it heal, then cuts aga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera/phone drops and we see a dutched image of Laur Gabriela comforts her, saying "What are you doing, baby?" Spanish. Laura cries on her shoulder. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A soldier who cannot be controlled is not a good soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LONG LENS GLIMPSE OF THE RED HAIRED MAN, temperamental, gesticulating, walking up a corridor, trailed by PIERCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside this building is something new. Something better than X-23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTAINING ADULT HUMAN ORGANS, LIMBS submerged in liquids collagen forms: arms, hearts, feet-- some being harvested

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got inside yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE RED HAIRED MAN confers with technicians. A Reaver not Gabriela who hides her camera/phone. She claims (in Spani to be lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They told us to destroy files. They said the Cancer program had failed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The female Mexican staff, some crying, shred medical file out the door a child is dragged away by A REAVER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They started putting the children to sleep. Like dogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear Gabriela telling them (in Spanish) that "we canno let them do this". Some of the staff meet her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are going to save as many as we can. I have read about a place in the north. A place for mutants. They call it Eden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHILDREN. Exhortations to the kids to keep running. GUNFI

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN REACTS TO THE CHAOS.
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have not shown anyone what you have now seen. Not until I am sure Laura is safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you are watching this, it means I am dead. I am not sure if any other children survived. We were separated. I am sorry, but there is no more money. That was a lie. You have everything I have in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan reacts to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is not my child... but I love her. You may not love her but she is your child. I see now you are not a hero. You are not what I read about. Maybe you never were. But please, I beg you, please bring her to safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The recording ends. Logan tosses the phone down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches up for the mirror, adjusts it so he can see--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura. Lying there, in a ball, sleeping, a plastic horse in her hands. Some comic books under her head. Suddenly, awakes, her eyes meeting his. And holding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan blinks under the weight of her gaze. Then she looks away and rolls over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura awakes on the leatherette bench and looks up to Charles, sleeping soundly, holding her hand. Colored ligh passes over his face. She turns to see lights playing out her window. She sits up to face--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SPECTACLE OF A MODERN GAMBLING STRIP. Dancing lights thematic facades throb like fireworks. A car passes, blas thumping hip hop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles blinks awake. We see in his eyes a quiet panic as looks out at his surroundings and, for a moment, seems to have no idea how he got here nor who these people are. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura meets his eyes. It starts to come back to him. He l out the window as they pull into a Casino parking area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Is this where we're hiding out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not hiding out. We're gonna get a couple hours sleep, clean up, get new clothes, ditch the limo, get a new ride and get the fuck out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan pulls to a stop a valet who eagerly approaches unti sees the thrashed condition of their ride and its frazzle passengers. Logan hands him cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it out front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura steps out, clinging to her horse. Dazzled by the throbbing lights and sexy throbbing musak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weary, Logan holds an electronic key in his hand as the threesome moves past slots and gambling tables still operating in the middle of the night. Laura is overwhelme noise, lights and activity. She jumps WHEN A LOUD BELL RI as someone wins a jackpot. Charles puts a hand on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan hits the UP button of the elevator and, as they wai for the doors to open, they all looks at--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DISPLAY FOR A CASINO CLOTHING STORE. A male mannequin i handsome western wear stands beside a shapely Cowgirl and little kid mannequin in a unicorn tee/skirt and studded d jacket. Charles eyes a suit and hat on a mannequin in an chair with a pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bing! -- the elevator doors open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter, Logan pushing Charles who carries shopping ba in his lap and tries on a new hat, tag attached. As the d close, Logan presses their floor, the button lights and L starts to press other floors. Logan swats her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, Charles digs in the bag, offers Logan a new baseball hat with a tag on it, tissue paper falling. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please wait till we're in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors suddenly re-open and there are A COUPLE (dresse nicely) and awkwardness as Logan hits the door close butt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Going up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura starts hitting other buttons again. He swats her ag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oklahoma City lies beyond the big windows, morning light filling this well appointed suite. We see the remains of room service breakfast. Clothing wrappers and boxes are scattered about. In a robe, Laura helps Charles finish donning his new outfit. Suddenly, there are gunshots from TV. Laura turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SCREEN -- A shootout in a 50's technicolor Western. Elisha Cook Jr is gunned down in the mud by Jack Palance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This film is a classic, Laura. Almost a hundred years old now. I first saw it at the Esoldo in Dewsbury when I was your age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ONSCREEN -- Now, it's a cemetery scene where the homestea sing a hymnal as they lower Elisha Cook Jr. to the ground

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A line of mini bar bottles stacked on the sink, Logan dre in front of the mirror. Exhaustion catching up with him, body still scarred from the battle at the smelting plant. finished buttoning a new shirt. Picks up his hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes land upon Laura's bloody clothes on the floor. H backpack nearby. Logan opens the backpack, pulls out thos files he'd seen before. TRANSIGEN and ALKALI stamped on t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flips through them -- records for the young mutants (s we saw on Gabriela's videos), we glimpse details:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: X23-44: Projects himself into other people via ocular loc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: X23-22: Can FREEZE OBJECTS with her cryogenic breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: X23-20: Can TRANSFORM AND MOVE ORGANIC PLANT LIFE -- gras trees, plants, a sort of green "Magneto".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: X23-11: Can generate seismic energy in nearby objects... Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan keeps flipping through the files, until he finds th one he's really looking for: LAURA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "High IQ" "Volatile emotional swings" "Difficult to contr "Signs of Manic Depression in source genetics."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clinical photos of Laura's Adamantium implant. Medical im of this little girl on a stainless table, in exquisite pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan can't look anymore. They bring back his own dark memories. Closing it, he finds a WRINKLED PHOTO clipped t the back. It's of GABRIELA AND ANOTHER NURSE (MARIA) WITH OTHER YOUNG MUTANTS IN A LAB. On back is that address in North Dakota. And a list of names: "Delilah, Rictor, Bobb Rebecca, Laura and Charlotte."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan tucks the file back in the backpack, then notices something else... wadded in a side pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEVERAL COMIC BOOKS. X-MEN comic books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...For fuck's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Pierce and his Reavers show up and take over the place They start sealing it off, and head in to the MINI MART..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clerk is scared/confused as Pierce and a Reaver enter lock the door behind them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you guys? More cops? Dude, I already told them everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where a battered Caliban sits, guarded by a Reaver, the r slicker in his lap. The Reaver beside him reaches over an raises the SHADE. Caliban recoils and we now see the blis on his face from the previous exposure to light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura finishes tying her NEW SHOES amid some clothing box She also wears a new unicorn shirt, new skirt and legging The ones from the display. She's pleased and meets eyes w Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan, who emerges from the bathroom with the backpack. H doubletakes at her, then grabs another bottle from the mi bar. We hear canned gunfire from the next room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura crosses to Charles in the bedroom and sits on the e of the bed where he is watching "Shane." On screen, the b "shoot out" grabs Laura's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan walks in, watching indifferently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura remains riveted as on-screen-- SHANE KNEELS DOWN AN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man has to be what he is, Joey. Can't break the mould. I tried and it didn't work. There's no living with a killing. There's no going back. Right or wrong, it's a brand. A brand that sticks. Now run on home to your mother, and you tell her... everything's alright and there aren't any more guns in the valley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan looks up as he hears a sigh from Charles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan clears his throat and they both turn his way. He ho up the THE X-MEN COMIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You read this in your spare time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees the comic in his hand, backpack in the other--ge up and grabs them both from Logan and turns back to the f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do know this is bullshit, right? A quarter of it happened. And none like this. In the real world, people die and no self promoting asshole in a leotard can stop it. This is just ice cream for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Logan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan turns to Charles who forces a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Laura well understands life's impermanence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you say something about finding us a new ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan looks at the two of them, all chummy now, and gets

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses at the door and tosses a pill vial to Charles. Laura catches it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take two more in an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-bye, Logan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Logan drives past a USED CAR dealership. He goes aroun the corner, starts looking around, goes another few block until he sees what he's looking for--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shitty block. Graffiti everywhere. A GANG OF YOUNG THUGS beneath the interstate overpass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan gets out of his limo, checks the back, sees a coupl more of Laura's UNCANNY X-MEN COMICS lying on the bench. Grabs them. Checks that's everything. Then finds several Charles pills wedged in the car seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams the door, walking past THE THUGS, tossing them t LIMO KEYS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock yourselves out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking toward the car lot, Logan eyes the cars in the lo all with sale written on their windshields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, the thugs cross to the limo, glancing at Loga before getting in, and laying rubber in the other directi Logan flips the liquor bottle in the trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan stands before a USED RAM FOUR DOOR with a large cab shell in back and faded electrician signage on the sides. A Dealer smoking a vape stands too close. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the finish looks beat but it's a `19, got less than sixty on the ody and three hundred horses under the hood. For 10 grand I can get it re-painted for you, fresh tires mounted and balanced, and complete paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...yeah. Here's the thing. I'll give you twelve as is-- if you can forget the paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dealer smiles. Looks at the money Logan is holding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still need tires, tiger. They're bald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long is that gonna take?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hour, maybe less. If you want, you can get yourself a glass a lunch across the street while you wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan looks to the BAR / LOUNGE across the street. Inviti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan sits, glancing at the television news, sipping a hi ball as he stares at one of Laura's UNCANNY X-MEN COMICS. images weigh on Logan. He downs his drink and shuts the comic, then he sees another XMEN COMIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His face becomes grim as he stares at THE COVER. It featu a DRAMATIC MUTANT TREK INTO THE MOUNTAINS. The title: "EX TO EDEN!" A subtitle: "MUTANT TRAIL OF TEARS!".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the cover and pages to follow, THOUSANDS OF MUTANTS, FLEEING OPPRESSION, UNDER ATTACK, headed for a place call "Eden" in a vast wasteland. They're being lead by XMEN, a them Wolverine and Xavier. Wolverine in his yellow suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan turns the page where it is revealed-- "EDEN" IT'S A HIDDEN COMPOUND. On top of a cliff. Mutants are there, yo and old, thriving. Text in a panel reads-- Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: AN INSET ON A SPLASH PAGE SHOWS A MAPPING DEVICE IN XAVIE
dialogues.text: HAND. On the screen, a series of numbers, coordinates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan blinks, looking at the cash envelope he got from Gabriela. The exact same numbers are scrawled on it below fire road address. Logan glares, taking in the bald fact Eden is an imaginary place in a forty year old comic book

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `you gotta be fuckin' kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a refill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan looks up, still dazed. He shuts the comic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles, slides it) You passing through?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan nods. Puts down a large bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you headed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan lurches the new used pick up to a stop at the hotel entrance. Gets out and does not give the keys to the Vale

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir? Are the keys in it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's when he sees-- A MAN WITH A PROSTHETIC (CYBORG) HA standing at the entrance, talking in a cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarmed, Logan rounds the corner, moving past--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HOTEL GARDENER with a hedge trimmer, touching up a shru Looking for a side entrance, Logan passes other patrons, as he does, he clocks--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACK VEHICLES parked in a service entrance. And that's w it hits-- A RINGING SOUND. A SCREECH and Logan turns to s Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARS CRASHING INTO EACH OTHER ON THE STREET. He turns bac see the Worker unconscious on the ground, the hedge trimm whirring and bouncing in the grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE RINGING GETS LOUDER. Casino patrons are frozen in pla struggling to breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see LOGAN OUT THE WINDSHIELD as he moves toward the ca doors-- and we PAN TO--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIERCE AND A REAVER ASSOCIATE at a command console inside truck. But they too are PARALYZED FROM THE PSIONIC WAVE, CHOKING FOR AIR. In the bg, a battered burned Caliban is paralyzed by the wave, vibrating in his restraints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see on the console monitor, video feeds of body cams, quivering but frozen pictures of our hero's suite. We hea the sound of men struggling to breathe over the audio fee Alarms are ringing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RINGING LOUDER YET as Logan stumbles through the lobb passing Desk Clerks, Bellhops, Guests, all paralyzed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON -- LOGAN struggling forward. THE RINGING INCREAS as he lurches, zig-zagging the crowded floor jammed with PARALYZED GAMBLERS, DEALERS, CROUPIERS, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man sits, frozen, beside a slot machine spitting chips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOGAN SPRINTS PAST A CASINO ESCALATOR-- passing paralyzed hotel patrons being tossed off like toy soldiers--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Struggling to the elevators, pressing the button. Doors open and more people fall out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Logan rides up, RINGING GETS LOUDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And BING the doors open and -- THE SOUND DEAFENING-- Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AS LOGAN LEAPS OFF THE ELEVATOR and fights his way throug the rippling force, past A MAID, FROZEN beside her cart, struggling for air to make it around the corner and down

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CRACKED SUITE DOOR WHERE TWO ARMED REAVERS stand froz and gurgling for air, their weapons pointed inward.

dialogues.speaker: HE GUTS THE TWO FROZEN HELPLESS REAVERS IN TWO QUICK THRU
dialogues.text: Their blood and guts pour to the floor, their eyes wide a they perish in a standing rigor mortis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIERCE, HIS ASSOCIATE AND CALIBAN, still paralyzed the wa We see on their body cam monitors as Logan skewers the me their life support monitors blinking -- AGENT TERMINATED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan pushes through THE DOOR TO FIND-- A SURREAL SCENE: THREE MORE REAVERS FROZEN IN MID ATTACK. The room service cart up-ended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLES sits slumped in his chair, near the window, mouth a rictus-like grimace, body quivering, rippling waves of force emanating from his skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAURA, HER CLAWS OUT, is on the floor, semi-paralyzed, struggling to pull herself toward Charles' meds. She reac the hypodermic, attempts to hand it to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan who falls to his knees from the shrieking wave. He fumbles, almost dropping it, eyes starting to roll up in own head as he lunges and jams the needle into Charles' n

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, RINGING stops -- Logan falls back-- the remaining Reavers fall to the ground and, as they gasp fo air, Laura and Logan kill them all. Brutal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles is spent dazed, gasping for air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan peers down at one of the dead Reavers, checking him out, peering into his BODYCAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dealers, Bellhops, patrons all stumble about in a daze -- children crying -- some people are vomiting or clawing at their heads. SIRENS IN THE DISTANCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Logan comes out of an elevator pushing a dazed Charles his chair, Laura follows. Charles is horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. Oh God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan pushes Charles, fast, and Laura follows, dragging h backpack, making their way toward the glass doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They zig zag through the crowd of recently unstuck patron and employees, many sick and stumbling, choking, some cry some scream for medical help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bouncing in his chair, Charles stares at the suffering ar him, stricken with empathy-- and guilt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura lingers, watching A FAT MAN GET CPR FROM A PANICKED COCKTAIL WAITRESS. The man suddenly comes to life, suckin air. The waitress' face fills with wonder. Laura stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catching up, Laura follows Logan and Charles out the casi doors. We hear the rising sirens of approaching first responders as the trio moves to the new pick up truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan lifts Charles into the back seat, throws the chair back bed and gets in. Laura climbs in beside Charles, who stares out the back window at the chaos as they pull away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera pans with them as they depart, then finds--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEVERAL REAVER VEHICLES parked at the side of the buildin

dialogues.speaker: ON
dialogues.text: suddenly BURST OPEN. PIERCE stumbles out, dazed, sweaty. looks to emergency trucks approaching, cherry topped. The his eyes find-- FIVE REAVERS. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Restrained in the back of the truck, Caliban, blistered a weak, watches PIERCE, who leans against the truck to supp himself, chugs some water until he feels Caliban's stare SLAMS THE DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK. CLACK. CLICK. CLACK. Logan drives. A good distance from the Oklahoma City, topography has changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun breaks over the horizon. The radio chatters with breaking news reports on the event at the Casino-- speculation of a gas leak or food poisoning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...some noting a similarity to the incident last year in Westchester, New York that left 50 dead, and twice that many injured--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan SNAPS off the radio, quickly looks in back to see i Charles overheard it. Charles was sleeping. Opens his eye

dialogues.speaker: CLICK. CLACK. CLICK.
dialogues.text: Logan's eyes flit to Laura playing with the door lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at him in the mirror, CLICK, does it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said knock it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles takes a breath, closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a child, Logan. In point of fact she's--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long has it been since you took your meds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles. How long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I don't know. Two days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw what happened last night. If that shit had gone on longer, everyone at that casino--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did what I had to do to stop those men from taking Laura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't do anything. You freaked out and had a fucking seizure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you prefer me pharmaceutically castrated, rambling on like some lunatic. So much easier on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easier? There's nothing easy about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Yes please, be like the rest of the world and blame someone else for your boring shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know, Pop, I'm such a giant

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Self loathing. Anger. Disdain. Cowardice. Oh yes. Your peaks and your valleys. Mostly valleys-- it's all so Goddamn boring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura looks from one to the other, nervous for the first since she climbed into the car with these two. She starts flicking the locks again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You honestly derive no sense of purpose from what we're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a young mutant. Sitting in our car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where we are taking her, there are more of them. Does that mean nothing to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It means nothing to me. Especially since Nurse Gabriela made all this Eden shit up from fucking comic books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan realizes he's gone too far, tosses the bottle of pi to Laura, which, as usual, she catches like Willie Mays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give those to him. Take out two and give them to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now. For fuck's sake. Take the pills. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him the pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --GIVE HIM THE FUCKING PILLS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura hesitantly hands them to Charles who looks at Logan the mirror, holds up a pill for him to see, takes one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Logan can answer, A SIREN SOUNDS. A STATE TROOPER BEHIND THEM, LIGHTS FLASHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cop. Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does he want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan watches in the rearview as a TALL WOMAN TROOPER get out, puts on her shades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She. I might have been speeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure that's all it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it wasn't, there'd be a lot more than her behind us. (looks at Laura) I need you to please try and not kill this lady. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura retracts her claws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The female TROOPER, mirrored Ray-Bans (some things never change), raps on the window. Logan lowers it, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was I going a mite fast, officer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: License and registration, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan reaches into the glove box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just bought it, but I-- here--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any idea just how "mite" fast you were going, Mr... Howlett?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventy? Ish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try ninety six. (looks at him) Ish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. I didn't think this thing could make that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She peers over the top of her glasses into the back at Charles and Laura. Charles smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not from round here. It's harvest season. You need to be more careful. This your daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name, honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she does have a name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Trooper looks at Laura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That your name, honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And is this man your father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura looks at Logan. A pause. Then... nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My son has a bit of a lead foot. I try to tell him that Mount Rushmore will still be there and just as beautiful a day from now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Trooper finishes writing the ticket...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a nice family. Try to keep `em safe, James.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CARAVAN OF REAVER VEHICLES is parked in a large paved pull out area, like a weigh station or rest stop. Local police wave traffic past, clearing the way for--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FLATBED TRUCK approaching with a police escort. THERE IS A HUGE BOX STRAPPED IN THE BACK OF THE TRUCK. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON -- PIERCE, looking from the arriving flatbed to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HELICOPTER growing larger in the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beaten, burned and shaking, confined in the back, Caliban hears the approaching chopper and peers out through a security window, watching--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter land on the blacktop. He shifts to a secon window to see a better view of--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE RED HAIRED MAN FROM THE LAB, as he steps out of the chopper and heads directly to Pierce. A silent movie as Pierce gets his ass handed to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caliban's attention shifts back to the first window as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FLATBED TRUCK pulls up next to the control truck. Its HANDLERS look nervous. Inside the big box strapped in bac there is some sort banging, then a low guttural screaming

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, the Red Haired Man, carrying a medical case, approac the flatbed and opens the back hatch, disappearing the bi box. The screaming subsides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caliban collapses to the floor. Closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the pick-up truck passes a billboard that reads

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fields on either side of the endless ribbon of road. In t fields are HUGE AUTOMATED THRESHERS/HARVESTERS. The machi are several times bigger than what we see on farms today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Logan navigates the pick-up through what looks like a canyon of big trucks. Laura, face pressed to the glass, stares up and out the window at all of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of them inches over and Logan is almost run off the r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits the HORN, looks up at the driverless truck cab as pulls around. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN YOUR OWN LANE, ASSHOLE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Language, Logan. And you're screaming at a machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan flips off the truck anyway as he passes, gets clear all of them. Logan sees Charles shake his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, she can gut a man with her feet, but she can't hear naughty words?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can learn to be better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, better than me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, yes. And by the way, Laura's foot claws are an obvious result of her gender. (off Logan's look) In a pride of lions, females are caregivers of the young and hunters of the pride, they have front claws to hunt and foot claws for defense. They use the foot claw to strike the belly or bladder of the attacker, thus ensuring their escape and survival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura takes this in, turns and looks out the other window Logan sighs and drives on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAURA'S POV - ANOTHER CAR An older farm pick up truck tow A HORSE TRAILER. Laura stares at the animals as they pass

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the back seat of the pick up sits A TEENAGE BOY. He lo back at Laura. Up front are his MOTHER and FATHER. They a look this way, smile. A farm family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon Logan has left them behind, too. A moment of quiet i the car. Logan looks in the rearview at Charles and Laura Both seem calm, even serene, as they gaze out their windo Laura still looking back at the horses. ...Almost normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then A LOUD HORN and Logan looks ahead as he's nearly off the road by one of the GIANT HULKING VEHICLES coming the other direction, crossing into his lane. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan pulls the wheel one way then swerves back as LAURA' CLAWS EXTEND AND PUNCH THROUGH THE ROOF with one hand, ho Charles with the other so they don't get thrown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan struggles to gain control of the pick-up, spins the truck around so it's facing on-coming traffic, avoids ANO MEGA-TRUCK coming at them before he finally gets the pick onto the shoulder, facing in the direction they came from

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three of them watch down the highway from the shoulde (looking in the direction of where they just came) as--

dialogues.speaker: THE FAMILY TOWING THE HORSE TRAILER ARE RUN OFF THE ROAD
dialogues.text: one of the SAME CAREENING MEGA TRUCKS. Their horse traile tipping onto its side at an angle, its doors swinging wid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan, Charles and Laura watch as -- FOUR HORSES now leap from the trailer, running free...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Oh well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan twists the wheel, prepares to pull back onto the highway and drive away. Charles puts a hand on his should

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to help them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to keep moving. Someone will come along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone has come along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Father, Mother and Teenage Son run after THE HORSES N ON THE HIGHWAY. ANOTHER MEGA TRUCK NEARLY MISSING THEM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan sighs, straightening the wheel and driving up the shoulder toward them. Charles watches as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate! Get off the road!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE TEENAGE BOY (NATE) DODGES ANOTHER TRUCK as he attempt round up the panicked horses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He closes his eyes. Concentrates. Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: come to a stop in unison. They turn and lope to the side the road like a bunch of trained Lippizaners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mesmerized Laura climbs out of the pick-up, watching as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate pulls himself onto the bare back of one of the horse the mane, holds onto the other by a halter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan climbs out of the pick up and approaches the father who has crossed back to the trailer and cursing (rated G) tries to get the wagon out of the ditch. His wife climbs behind the wheel, gently spinning the tires to no effect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I give you a hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he opens his eyes and watches the boy ride/lead the animals back to the trailer door just as Logan and the Fa and Mother gas and heave-ho it back upright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watches from a middle distance. She's fascinated by the b and his ability with horses. But mostly by the boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mother now exits the cab, joins Nate, helping him loa the horses back into the carrier. She notices her son is angry. He slams the tailer doors behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, at the side of the truck, the father extends h hand to Logan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate this. Thank you. Will Munson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James. Howlett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mother now comes over with the boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you so much for your help, sir. I'm Kathryn, and this our son, Nate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan smiles at her. There's a connection. Kathryn looks their truck, sees Laura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that your daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan sees Laura standing beside the truck in the stolen shades, watching them. The boy now notices her for the fi time. Charles peers out the side door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. That's Laura. (as Charles waves) And that's my... dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you all headed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: North.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura's off at the trailer, petting one of the horses. The couple exchanges a look with each other, then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we at least give the three of you a decent meal, show our appreciation? We don't live far from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning out the car door) That would be lovely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you, we really can't--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura, get back here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. It's the least we can do. And you're going to have to stop for dinner somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON -- AN IV connected to Caliban's pale skin. A man fingers delicately adjust the drip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the 1950's, in an effort to increase honey production in the tropics, a Brazilian research team cross-bred the European Honey Bee, Apis mellifera, the classic model, and a heartier stronger African variety, Apis mellifera capensis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caliban opens his eyes and looks up at THE RED-HAIRED MAN His manner is soft, warm. His voice seductive, smooth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These hybrid bees were stronger and aggressive to be sure, but despite their fortitude, they made no honey at all, nor assist in pollination. In the lab, they did little, in fact, besides killing other bees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MAN sits close to CALIBAN, shining a pinlight on his lesions, in his ears. Examining. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The researchers wanted to help mankind, but instead, they created monsters. And before they could correct their error, a few escaped to the wild. And these bees formed a swarm and spread across Brazil and multiplied, moving up the continent, killing men women and children. Even worse, these killer hybrids threatened the viability of the worldwide bee population and subsequently, human survival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, the price of progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caliban's eyes flick out the window where --    Pierce ta with his remaining Reavers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My colleague tells me you've been somewhat resistant. He believes you're dispensing delayed information, allowing your friends to stay one step ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please let me be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm offering an opportunity, Caliban. To redeem yourself, to protect the world, and, in the process, save your friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caliban just looks back at him. Shudders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl is a rather small price to pay for that. Unlike you, she's not pure. She wasn't made by nature. She's a mistake of my own. A killer bee who's escaped from the hive. And I need to get her back before she stings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want from me?! I did what I could and your human toaster ovens fucked it all up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree the Reavers have not been effective. I'm bringing new tools to bear. But I still need someone to point us in the right direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no. I can't keep--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breathe. Breathe. What does he have, the old man, your friend? Alzheimer's? ALS? A degenerative brain disease in the world's most dangerous brain. What a combo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man considers Caliban a moment, then reaches in his b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You pay a high price for your gifts, my friend. Too bad you and I didn't meet years ago. I could have saved you some pain. I have something for your blisters. (pulling a vial of creme) My name is Dr. Rice, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meets his eyes) You can call me Zander if you like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Munson family and the "Howlett" family all sit around table covered with food, heads bowed as the son says grac All except Laura who looks around at the family pictures, religious decorations (they are everywhere), the warm furnishings. Another strange place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We thank you, Lord, for this food... and we also thank you, Lord, for sending our new friends, the Howletts to our aid today. Amen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all dig in. Laura eats like a wild animal, and the Munsons pause to watch. Charles puts a hand on her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow down, child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around at the others, all of whom smile at her, then slows down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's plenty more if you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you all heading?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oregon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: South Dakota.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oregon, then South Dakota.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vacation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Long overdue. We're city folk. Always wanted to take a road trip, see the country. (smiles at them) Meet the people who live in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan looks up at Charles. Watches him. The old man havin himself a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds lovely. I've been trying to get Will here to take a vacation for years now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if we go out traipsing around the country, who's gonna take care of this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. I say, let it go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And live off what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lord will provide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm still waiting for him to provide me with a new thresher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles at Charles) All the same, I'd love to travel someday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I bet you will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could drop out of school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not go that far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friendly laughter around the table. THE SOUND FADES. PASS OF TIME AS Laura watches the ritual of Family Dinner. Stu it. She's never really seen a family. Or, for that matter teenage boy. She keeps her eyes fixed on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then as DINNER FINISHES AND CLEAN UP BEGINS--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathryn, that was easily the best meatloaf I've ever had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Chuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles gives Logan a look across the table. Kathryn turn Logan now. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you, James. Are you married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I uh, I--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathryn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? It's a natural thing to ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was. She passed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will gives her a look that says, See? That's why you don' ask shit like that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He killed her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan looks up at Charles. An awkward beat. Then they all burst out laughing. Logan considers Charles across the ta Was that Dementia? A joke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan smiles at Kathryn, stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am, I can't thank you enough for dinner. But we have a long drive ahead of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to rest, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll find a motel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearest is two hours from here and it's not very--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gonna stay here. We have a perfectly fine room upstairs for your daughter and father and you can sleep in the living room on the convertible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathryn. That's very nice of you, but we really should hit the--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could leave first thing in the morning. Crack of dawn as it were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan grabs Charles' wheelchair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go wash up, Pop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan counts out two pills to Charles who finishes splash water on his face, and grabs a towel. They whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --two days on the road with one meal and hardly any sleep. She's eleven and I'm fucking ninety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a hundred and one reasons to keep moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a box of avocados.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then what. We stay the night and then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We take Laura to her friends in Eden and then... then we buy that Sunseeker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan just stares back at him, hands him his pills, goes fill a cup of water. The faucet sputters and spits air. T pipes shudder all through the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan emerges from the bathroom, Charles follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate, go fill up the tub before we lose pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate dutifully rushes into the bathroom, starts the tub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crosses to the window) They shut it off again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's "they?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura steps into the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You best deal with it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can wait till morning. We got rain last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathryn gently touches Will's arm. Her hand slides down t his. Laura is fascinated by the simple gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will. We have three guests in this house and sink full of dishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. You're right. (explaining to Logan) The pump station that supplies us is a mile and a half from here. Sometimes it gets itself shut off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By assholes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will gives his son a look. Charles gives Logan a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My son can go with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. Thank you. But these men who did this, they can be--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You have homework.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathryn and Logan meet eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just let me get my dad... settled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan wheels Charles toward the stairs. Nate passes them stomps up the steps. Laura watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura comes to the top of the stairs and looks at Charles empty wheel chair in the hallway. Logan carries Charles i a lit bedroom at the end of the hall. A sweet sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura turns looking in the cracked door of Nate's bedroom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the guest room, Logan tucks Charles in. Charles lo out the window beside the bed. The moon over the silos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a TV in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... Get some rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Logan turns away, Charles reaches for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Logan. This is what life looks like. A house, people who love each other. A safe place. Take a moment and feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still have time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan looks off, distant. Troubled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles. The world is not the same as it was. We're taking a risk here. And where we're going. Eden. It doesn't exist. Her nurse got it from a comic book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles stays quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just need to understand-- it's not real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles looks up at Logan, his tone gentle, and firm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is for Laura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan passes Laura as he comes down the stairs. He follow Will down the hall. A GUN COCKS and Logan sees Will has opened A CABINET, tucking a pistol in his waistband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. We won't need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Logan and Will carry tools along a dirt access road...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Canewood Beverage bought up everything out here. Except us. When we wouldn't sell, they tried eminent domain. Then screwing with our water. Couple months ago, someone poisoned our dogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So today, out on the highway--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows. Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking at the giant harvesters working the dark fields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're like dinosaurs. Twenty ton bodies with little tiny brains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They work day and night, no drivers, shucking their cloned up super-corn. Bears fruit in half the time. Taste like shit, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why do people eat it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't. They drink it. (off Logan's look) Corn syrup. Its in all those drugged up drinks everyone's having nowadays-- to stay awake, feel strong, cheer up, sexy, whatever. Used to be a time when a bad day was just a bad day, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine still are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will leads Logan to a PUMP HOUSE. A tangle of intersectin irrigation pipes under a canopy. The lock HAS BEEN BROKEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan looks out into the night, cautious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will sets his tools down and looks at the pump. Someone h opened up all the valves and the place is now flooding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like we'll be here a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan finds a convenience store cigar in his pocket. Ligh it. Enjoys the moment, wind blowing through the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodeo trophies, posters, etc. The room of a kid who loves everything about that world. Nate -- ear buds in -- does homework while listening to music. He looks up and sees--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAURA standing in the doorway watching his every move. She looks at the trophies, curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances at her, but tries to focus on his homework. Erases something on his electronic writing pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at the pad's screen. A series of equations with blanks to fill in and chicken scratch in the digital marg He pulls out one of the buds, waves a stylus, and explain Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not too good at math.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at the equations on the pad, the screen litter with scribbles, things crossed out, then looks once more the trophies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those two are for breakaway roping. Those for barrel racing. Those up there are for pole bending. But all second, third place. I'm not so good at it. My dad makes me do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just looks at him. Stares at him, really. Hears music coming from the dangling bud and looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna listen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the bud in her ear so that they now each have one

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called "Devil's Whisper". It's by Raury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She listens to the music a moment, cuts her eyes at the o boy who can feel her looking at him. Takes a whiff of him finally pulls the bud from his own ear and gently passes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Take it for tonight. I'll get it back in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just looks back at him. He holds up his stylus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta do my homework. (holds out his hand) Good-night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at his extended hand. Then looks at the screen the pad. She takes the stylus and hunches over him and quickly scrawls on the screen--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what are you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he realizes that she's doing the equations. One afte the other. Just like that. She finishes, then straightens

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOW she shakes his hand. He notices little ridges on her knuckles. Looks up at her as she puts the other bud in he ear and walks out. He sighs, goes back to his work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles lies in the bed, already asleep. Laura walks in a pads to the other side of the bed and curls up on the flo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lies there, listening to Nate's music. She clings to WRINKLED PHOTO of the mutant kids, like a talisman. A hin a smile as she looks out at the moonlight, eyes heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Logan and Will finish closing and resetting the huge irrigation valve. A two-man job to get the giant bolt loc back down. As they work...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long's your girl been that way? (off Logan's look) Mute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since... well.. the beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some ways I envy you. They get to be Nate's age, the nonsense that comes out their mouth. Makes you question the point of it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan smiles, nods. Tell me about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard thing, fatherhood. Never ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan considers Will a long moment as the man works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a lucky man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WATER FINALLY STOPS RUSHING IN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That should hold it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until the next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan watches a TRUCK come up the road as Will puts a new lock on the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know why I bother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He now turns and sees the vehicle as well. Steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here, James. I'll handle this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will walks forward with a thick wrench at his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Truck pulls up. On the side it says CANEWOOD BEVERAGE FOUR BIG MEN get out. All with weapons. One of them gets on the driver's side, holding a rifle. This is JACKSON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evening, Mr. Munson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will just nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What brings you out this way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you ask your boys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You understand, you're trespassing right now, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an easement with the previous owner of your property.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Previous being the operative word. (looks at Logan) Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (before Will can speak) I'm nobody. Just a guy telling you to get back in your nice truck and play Okie dickhead somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackson smiles, cuts a look at the others, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hire some muscle, Mr. Munson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a friend of mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A friend with a big mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear that a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you probably hear this, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now he cocks the rifle. Logan nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than I'd like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you know the drill. I'm gonna count to three and you are gonna start walking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods to the dark field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got rights to this water --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I have a lawyer now--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's when Logan reaches out and snatches the rifle Jackson by the barrel, surprising everyone. Especially wh he slams the butt of it into Jackson's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackson goes down to his knees clutching his bloody face the other three move on Logan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will pulls his pistol and hits one across the face, point at the other two as Logan flips the rifle, points it at t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all know the drill. (fires above their heads) Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They haul Jackson to his feet, throw him in the truck, tu around and drive back the way they came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan breaks the rifle over his knee and throws the piece into the field. He turns to see Will staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've had training.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet. A moment. As Logan and Will walk back up the road. Feeling good about what they've accomplished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wish I had you around all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you don't want to stay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I'll take a drink if you got one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathryn doesn't like booze in the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I got something in the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crickets buzz in the fields. A breeze blows. Charles lies awake, looking out at the crescent moon over the farm. Hi eyes travel downward to find-- Laura asleep on a hooked r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then: A FLOORBOARD CREAKS and Charles turns to see-- LOGA in the doorway, in silhouette. He looks at Laura asleep o the floor, curled like a shrimp. He takes a step toward h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Don't wake her yet. Let her have another hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan looks at Charles. Charles lays back on the pillow looking out the window at the farm. Something stirring hi Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...This was, without a doubt, the most splendid night I've had in a long time. ...but then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Logan takes another step toward Laura, Charles tremble He does not look away from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I don't deserve it, do I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I did something... unspeakable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remembered what happened in Westchester. This was not the first time I've hurt people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pain fills his eyes) Until today, I didn't know. You wouldn't tell me. We just kept running from it. I'm done running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles turns to Logan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I finally understand you, Logan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the burden you carry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan arrives at Charles bedside. Puts his hand on Charle shoulder. Charles cocks his head, perplexed, looking up a him in the shadows. Something is wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles GASPS. Logan pulls his hand back and that's when see his CLAWS ARE BLOODY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the floor, LAURA OPENS HER EYES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles LOOKS UP FROM HIS WOUND, blood coming. He tries t reach a bedside light and succeeds as again-- THE CLAWS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For simplicity's sake, let's call this creature BAD LOGAN Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He will also be referenced as "X-24", his model number. H is a younger, stronger, clone of The Wolverine. Feral, he moves in a slight crouch. He is not the absence of emotio but rather, the presence of it, most noticeably, rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAURA FLIES AT BAD LOGAN, SHRIEKING, landing on his back, gouging his flesh. He spins, trying to shake her, swiping his back with his blades. He stumbles across the room and slams his back on the wall, crushing her, plaster crackin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAURA DROPS TO THE GROUND. Dazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATE STANDS IN THE DOORWAY, a Louisville Slugger in his h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His wide eyes take in Charles, bleeding, still moving, La on the floor, claws covered in blood. Then he looks to BA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A METALLIC THWACK as the bat connects with Bad Logan's he but the clone hardly registers the impact AS WE CUT TO :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tinny transmitted sounds of the violence play off scr as we look at the Munson farmhouse a ways off through a windshield. PAN TO REVEAL--

dialogues.speaker: WE'RE IN THE ALKALI COMMAND VEHICLE. PIERCE AND DR. RICE
dialogues.text: riveted to a feed from Bad Logan's bodycam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your baby boy just took out the most wanted mutey in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's fantastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caliban stares, stricken, his face pressed against the ba in his cage in the rear of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you wanted the girl! You said you just wanted the girl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER REAVER SMACKS THE CAGE, knocking Caliban down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you I was forced to bring a new tool to bear. He's just a baby and a bit of a blunt instrument.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But your friends had every chance. And so did you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE THE SEVERAL REAVER/ALKALI VANS nestled in an overg section of country road, among them the FLATBED WITH THE BOX. Only the big doors are wide open... WE PAN TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Munson corn field. Logan (regular Logan) and Will are coming down the irrigation road toward the Munson Farm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since Nate was born, I try not to imbibe much. Maybe once a month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passing the sheds and equipment, Logan crosses toward his pick-up truck as Will breaks for the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm guessing you enjoy a drink more often than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only on days that end in "Y."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying Laura, BAD LOGAN steps over NATE'S GUTTED BODY a heads down the hall toward the stairs. We hear A SHOTGUN and see-- Kathryn in her bedroom door with a two barrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad Logan stares at her. Drops Laura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathryn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay down there, Will!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan grabs a booze bottle from the glove box. And that's when he turns, smelling something. The horses in the corr seem excited. LOGAN'S HEAD SNAPS UP.

dialogues.speaker: GUNSHOTS RING OUT. SCREAMS FROM THE HOUSE.
dialogues.text: Final Shooting - 8/23/2016

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON-- LAURA, pinned in the restraining device on the floor where Bad Logan dropped her, lying on her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM HER DUTCHED POV -- we see Bad Logan killing Will who tumbles down the stairs. We also see Kathryn dead, beside Nate, also lifeless. Tears fill Laura's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pellets rain from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura looks up to -- Bad Logan, wounds healing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She struggles in rage as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad Logan picks her up moves to the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Logan sets eyes upon--

dialogues.speaker: A DOUBLE OF HIMSELF COMING DOWN THE STEPS, CARRYING LAURA
dialogues.text: A reincarnation of Weapon X. From the floor, Will's eyes on Logan, life draining from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan meets Bad Logan's yellow eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan glances to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blood drenched stairs-- where he last saw Charles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura watches, trapped in the restraints as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad Logan suddenly moves away, with Laura toward the fron

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOGAN RACES UPSTAIRS but the camera stays at the bottom, looking upward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands over Charles, ravaged and bloody. Their eyes me Charles is still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
